output.conclusion: By completing this course, you've gained a foundational understanding of algorithmic trading strategies. You are now equipped to explore more advanced concepts and develop your own trading algorithms. Remember to always backtest your strategies and manage your risk effectively.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Algorithmic Trading Strategies for Beginners course! This course will introduce you to the exciting world of automated trading. We'll cover the fundamental concepts, popular strategies, and essential tools you need to get started. No prior experience is required!

chapters.description: What is algorithmic trading? Benefits and risks. Key terminology (e.g., backtesting, slippage, latency).
Choosing a broker with API access. Introduction to Python for algorithmic trading. Installing necessary libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy).
Downloading historical market data. Cleaning and preparing data for analysis. Storing data efficiently.
Understanding moving averages. Implementing a simple moving average crossover strategy. Backtesting and evaluating performance.
Understanding the RSI indicator. Implementing an RSI-based overbought/oversold strategy. Optimizing parameters for different market conditions.
Understanding Bollinger Bands. Implementing a Bollinger Bands breakout strategy. Combining Bollinger Bands with other indicators.
Importance of backtesting. Key metrics for evaluating strategy performance (e.g., Sharpe ratio, drawdown). Avoiding overfitting.
Setting stop-loss orders. Position sizing techniques. Managing capital allocation.
Connecting your algorithm to your broker's API. Setting up automated execution. Monitoring your trades.
